Class PoolBall

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jogamp.java3d.SceneGraphObject
      • org.jogamp.java3d.Node
        • org.jogamp.java3d.Group
          • org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup
            • objects.PoolBall

  • public class PoolBall
extends org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup
    Abstract class for a pool ball. Subclass this, calling the super constructor and filling in the appropriate values (colour and point value)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PoolBall.Type
      Enum for every different type of Snooker ball

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private org.jogamp.vecmath.Color3f clr
      Colour of the sphere for this ball
      static double dragCa
      Drag constant for slowing down pool balls, units per frame
      static double dragCo
      Drag coefficient for slowing down pool balls, spd*dragCo per frame
      static double height
      The Y-up value that all balls spawn and rest at
      private boolean inMotion
      Is true if the ball is currently translating position
      private int pointValue
      Number of points this ball is worth
      private org.jogamp.vecmath.Vector3d pos
      Worldspace position of this ball
      private org.jogamp.vecmath.Vector3d prevPos
      The position this pool ball was previously at, last frame
      static float radius
      The radius of each pool ball
      static float radius2
      Equal to radius squared
      static double spdLimit
      A speed below this limit is considered neglibile and should be set to 0
      static double spdLimit2
      Equal to spdLimit squared
      private org.jogamp.java3d.Transform3D t
      The transform that translates this ball to it's position
      private org.jogamp.vecmath.Vector3d vel
      The velocity of this ball in units per frame, or 16ms

      Returns the colour of this ball

      Static method that returns the y-up height that all pool balls spawn, move, and rest at.
      int getPointValue()
      Returns the number of points this ball is worth
      org.jogamp.vecmath.Vector3d getPos()
      Returns a new vector of this pool ball's position,
      and therefore the translation of this pool ball.
      double getPosX()
      Returns the x position of this pool ball,
      and therefore the x component translation of this pool ball.
      double getPosZ()
      Returns the z position of this pool ball,
      and therefore the z component translation of this pool ball.

      Returns the x position this pool ball was previously at

      Returns the z position this pool ball was previously at

      Returns the speed of this pool ball

      Returns the speed of this pool ball, squared
      double getVelX()
      Returns the x velocity of this pool ball
      double getVelZ()
      Returns the z velocity of this pool ball
      boolean isInMotion()
      Returns whether this pool ball is in motion,
      or, has a non-negligible velocity.
      void setPos(double x, double z)
      Sets the position and therefore translation of this pool ball,
      and updates the transform this pool ball belongs to.
      void setVel(double x, double z)
      Sets the velocity of this pool ball,
      and updates inMotion appropriately.
      void stop()
      Sets this pool ball's velocity to zero and sets inMotion to false.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PoolBall

        public PoolBall(PoolBall.Type type,
                double x,
                double z)
        Default and only constructor for a pool ball
        Parameters:
        type - The type of Snooker pool ball. Use the enum PoolBall.Type
        x - x-right position of this ball to spawn and rest at
        z - z-forward position of this ball to spawn and rest at

      • createBallAppearance

        private static org.jogamp.java3d.Appearance createBallAppearance(org.jogamp.vecmath.Color3f clr)
        private static method that creates an Appearance for this ball of the given colour. Only used in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        clr - The colour to set the new appearance to
        Returns:
        The new Appearance object, to make our sphere with
